item.description:
Presenter: David Herlihy

Description: Frank Lenz had a mission: to show the public that the new-fangled "safety" bicycle offered practical and enjoyable exercise. In 1892, Lenz left his home in Pittsburgh to circle the globe on a 57-pound Victor with inflatable tires. He never made it back, despite having covered some 15,000 miles across North America and Asia. Two years into his epic journey, he disappeared mysteriously in Eastern Turkey. David V. Herlihy, author The Lost Cyclist will discuss the Lenz case and show numerous unpublished photographs taken by Lenz himself from 1890 - 1894.
item.how_to_find_us: in the basement, warehouse area, behind the desk
item.why: you like biking, traveling, adventure and an unsolved mystery to boot.

group.name: Greater Boston Sierra Club Environmental Meetup Group

item.name: The Lost Cyclist
